key_facts: Canada eliminated the consumer carbon tax in 2024.
Gasoline prices dropped by over six cents per litre in eight provinces.
New Brunswick experienced the steepest price decline.
Consumers could save over C$500 annually, according to the Canadian Fuels Association.
Quebec is now the only province with a carbon levy.
Quebec saw a slight gasoline price increase.
Experts say lower prices may encourage more domestic car travel.
Potential U.S. tariffs could reduce Canadian fuel demand.
Economic uncertainties may also affect fuel consumption.
The full impact of the tax repeal on fuel use is still unclear.
